result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kristy L. Malnory was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kristy L. Malnory in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 17CM-159 and 16CM-141.

9:41 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Defendant indicates she lives at the Point Motel, temporarily.
Defendant works at Subway, full time.

There is a plea agreement.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.

16CM-141: Defendant will plead to Count 1. State recommends 60 day jail sentence, $1,870, $26.45, 29 month IID/Revocation
Count 2: Dismissed
Count 3: Dismissed and read in

17CM-159: Dismised and read in

Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Drengler states this is still a third offense. The other OWI is still working it's way through the system.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CM-141: Count 1: No Contest

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Defendant understands she has two prior convictions.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
16CM-141: Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
16CM-141: Count 2: Dismissed
16CM-141: Count 3: Dismissed and read in
17CM-159: Dismissed and read in

Atty Mukoski makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
Atty Drengler requests the Court to sign the half priced ignition interlock.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
16CM-141:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 60 days
4 days jail credit
Huber granted for work and any counseling and child care
22 days must be in jail, balance may be on GPS home detention
Report to jail immediately
Pay a fine of $1,870
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
Get on a payment plan today
Ignition Interlock Device for 30 months
Drivers License Revocation for 29 months
DOT Assessment and comply with safety plan   BAC: .185

20 days in which to appeal.

6/20/2018 - All conditions previously ordered are continued: 
Maintain absolute sobriety.   
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.  
Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.  
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

**Amended as of May 27, 2016 by Court Order /s/ TTF 05/26/16: 
*Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *Court dates 
*No longer required to participate in the Pretrial Supervision Program.

Defendant Kristy L. Malnory appeared by video. Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 16CM141, 17CM159

Atty Drengler makes statements to the Court regarding the defendant's failure to appear being family medical issues.  The court date could not be moved as the request was denied due to the matter being rescheduled numerous times. 

BY THE COURT:  Court quashes the warrant. 

State recommends a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Drengler makes bond arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Court orders a $500 cash bond in 16CM141 with all conditions as previously ordered.  Court reinstates the bond in 17CM159.

Parties are to go immediately to the Br 3 office to schedule the next hearing date and notify the clerk so that notices are sent.
